abstract.para: The behavior of &nm; is defined in its central configuration file /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf. The system runs with the built-in defaults and the NetworkManager.conf file is not mandatory but required to modify the behavior. You can create or modify the NetworkManager.conf according to your requirements.

topic.para: NetworkManager.conf is the primary location for configuring behavior and settings of &nm;, including logging, connection management, and network device handling.

The file consists of sections of key-value pairs. Each key-value pair must belong to a section. A section starts with a name enclosed in []. Lines beginning with a # are considered comments. A common configuration includes the [main] section with the plugins value, [logging], and [connectivity]:

callout.para: Manages how the connection profiles are stored. The [keyfile] plug-in supports all the connection types and capabilities of &nm;.
Defines connection defaults and options and specifies the URI to check the network connection.
Manages the &nm; logging levels and domains.

procedure.title: Configuring NetworkManager.conf
procedure.para: Ensure that you take a backup of the existing configuration file before modifying the file.

note.para: Create a new NetworkManager.conf if this is not available by default.
